channel.title: Sports - Digg
channel.description: Sports on Digg: the best articles, videos, tweets, and original content that the web is talking about right now

item.title: Russian Olympic Swimmer Julia Evimova Couldn't Swim In A Pool, So She Is Practicing In The Kitchen Instead Like This
item.description: Please, please do not try this at home.

item.title: We Simulated A Video Game With The Worst College Basketball Team Ever, And Got An Instant Classic
item.description: Seasons No. 2 and No. 3 in SB Nation's quest to win a national title with Western Illinois in "College Hoops 2K8"

item.title: To Run My Best Marathon At Age 44, I Had To Outrun My Past
item.description: After 20 years of long-distance competition, I ran my fastest. All it took was tech, training and a new understanding of my life.

item.title: Where Does Scottie Pippen Rank Among The NBA's All-Time Greats?
item.description: Only Jordan was a better all-around player in the '90s... and that was debatable.

item.title: Michael Jordan Art Directed His Most Iconic Dunk By Himself
item.description: Michael Jordan helped out the veteran photographer Walter Iooss Jr. after telling him which way he was going to dunk in the contest. That tip led Iooss Jr. to capture an iconic moment in MJ's career.

item.title: Genius Designed A Basketball Hoop Where The Ball Always Goes In
item.description: A YouTuber wrote some software to come up with the most optimal basketball backboard possible and then built it.

item.title: Gymnast Breaks The Matrix, Pulls Off A True Standing Double Backflip On Grass
item.description: Kaleb Cave seems to have pulled off a true standing double backflip on grass. It's wild

item.title: Why Michael Jordan Was The Best
item.description: The Bulls legend was — and still is — basketball's GOAT.

item.title: We Asked A Classics Professor How To Train Like A Real-Life Roman Gladiator
item.description: There's no training manual handy. But art has left us some clues.

item.title: The Quarantine Chess Tournament That Could Change The Game Forever
item.description: After the FIDE Candidates tournament was postponed due to the coronavirus, world champion Magnus Carlsen decided to take things into his own hands. His version of chess could speed the game up permanently.

item.title: Watch These Catholic Sisters From Spain Play A Game Of Pick-Up Basketball While Stuck In Quarantine
item.description: This video of nuns playing basketball at the convent of San Leandro in Sevilla, Spain is the most wholesome thing you might see today.

item.title: This Epidemiologist Proved 10,000 Steps Is A Lie
item.description: I-Min Lee gives us the story behind the mysterious fitness benchmark.

item.title: Little League, Revisited
item.description: Adam Kuhlmann was outmatched at the 1993 Little League World Series. His 11-year-old nephew helps him to learn from his errors.

item.title: Lionel Messi's 73-Goal Season Was A Triumph — And A Disaster For Barcelona
item.description: Remembering Lionel Messi's wildest season ever.

item.title: Keirin School: Inside The Strict And Secret World Of Bicycle Racing In Japan
item.description: Keirin racing in Japan is a big business that is rich in traditions too. Its intriguing world says a lot about our Olympics hosts.

item.title: Watch This Guy Crush The Record For Most Push-Ups In An Hour
item.description: Aussie Jarrad Young completed an eye-popping 2,806 push-ups in one hour — a world record.

item.title: The Logistical Hell Of Postponing The Olympics For One Year
item.description: Pushing back the Tokyo Games requires so much, all in the face of an unpredictable pandemic.

item.title: This Boy Really Couldn't Care Less About Practicing Tennis With His Tennis Coach Dad
item.description: The ultimate baller move is to just not give a f*ck.

item.title: NASCAR Driver Says N-Word During Virtual Racing Event, Immediately Gets Suspended
item.description: Driver Kyle Larson appeared to think his mic was off during an iRacing event over the weekend. It was not.

item.title: Simone Biles Takes Viral Handstand Challenge To Impressive New Level
item.description: The handstand challenge started by Tom Holland involved Holland trying to put on a shirt while doing a handstand. Olympics gymnast Simone Biles took that challenge and made it so much better.

item.title: The 1904 Olympic Marathon Was The Worst Race Ever Run
item.description: The 1904 St. Louis Olympics were the first held outside Europe. Which sounds great until you remember that it was 1904, and the direct center of this vast country wasn't the easiest place to get to. In fact, St. Louis was so remote that most countries didn't bother to make the trip.

item.title: Tony Hawk Never Sold Out
item.description: Tony Hawk is the most famous skateboarder of all time. Here he reminds us that, fame and fortune aside, skateboarding is still his number one priority.

item.title: Watch This BBC Sports Broadcaster Give Colorful Commentary Of His Dogs Fighting Over A Chew Toy
item.description: Marooned BBC sports announcer Andrew Cotter is back at it again. After giving the play-by-play of his dogs racing to eat their food back in March, Cotter has another event he's giving detailed running commentary: Mabel and Olive competing over a chew toy.

item.title: This Man Set A New World Bench Press Record While Fully Submerged Underwater
item.description: Greg Wittstock performed the most consecutive reps of a bench press while completely underwater.

item.title: How Bruno Sammartino Escaped Nazis And Bullies To Become The Most Popular Wrestler In America
item.description: Sammartino died at in 2018 at the age of 82, but his legacy lives on.

item.title: Here's An Extremely Dedicated Man's Incredible Journey Around The World On A Unicycle
item.description: In March 2015, 19-year-old Ed Pratt had a dream: to ride around the world on a unicycle.

item.title: Zen, Ultra-Running And The Art Of Suffering
item.description: There are many levels of suffering in ultras, but when runners talk about their pain, they are referring to the point when physical discomfort collides with cognitive distress, creating a condition that is both excruciating and exhilarating. As Avery Collins puts it, breaking through that wall is like experiencing a mental orgasm.

item.title: These Spot On Impressions Show What NBA Player Would Look Like If They Played Soccer
item.description: Here's what the styles of players like Steph Curry and LeBron James would look like if they were on the soccer field.

item.title: Inside SportsCenter On The Day We Lost Sports
item.description: Empty parking lots, no highlights and three live shows a day: This is how ESPN's 40-year-old program is fighting through the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: 'We're All Effed. There's No Other Way To Look At This, Is There?'
item.description: As coronavirus threatens to alter, or even cancel, the 2020 college football season, the entire NCAA system could hang in the balance.

item.title: The Quarantine Backyard Ultra Is Perfectly Insane
item.description: It's an isolated struggle against an invisible adversary for an indefinite amount of time. Sound familiar?

item.title: How Sports Radio Hosts Became America's Grief Counselors
item.description: Longtime broadcasters like Mike Francesa and Paul Finebaum have shifted their shows to reflect the coronavirus pandemic. And they're making their audiences rethink how they see the world.

item.title: The Olympics Timeline Has Been Cruel To Simone Biles
item.description: Her birthdate already kept her from more gold medals — and a delayed Olympics won't help.

item.title: Skier Finds A Genius Way To Ski In His Living Room In Cute Stop-Motion Short
item.description: Philipp Klein Herrero was supposed to go freeriding with is family before the COVID-19 pandemic struck. Fortunately for the internet, he found a way to ski in the space of his room.

item.title: The Bucs Built It, Tom Brady Came. Now What? Inside The GOAT's Ultimate Gamble
item.description: Operation Shoeless Joe Jackson — that's what the "Field of Dreams" fans inside the Tampa Bay front office called their pursuit of Tom Brady.

item.title: Talented Dog Plays Volleyball With Humans, Absolutely Nails It
item.description: Kiara the dog is a real good sport.

item.title: Sources: President Donald Trump Says NFL Season Should Start On Time
item.description: In a conference call with major league sports commissioners on Saturday, President Donald Trump said he believes the NFL season should start on time in September, sources familiar with the call told ESPN.
item.kicker: 'I WANT FANS BACK IN THE ARENAS'

item.title: The Story Of Richard Petty's Dad Protesting His First NASCAR Win
item.description: Before Richard Petty became a racing legend, his dad, Lee, was hellbent on making sure he earned every win.

item.title: A Summer With No Slams
item.description: The tennis schedule has not been spared the desolation wreaked by the coronavirus. But perhaps no other sport features so many epic champions at the late stages of their careers.

item.title: How NBA Coaches Are Navigating An Unprecedented Season
item.description: Frank Vogel, Nick Nurse and other NBA coaches are figuring out how to lead their teams through the uncertainty of a season stoppage.

item.title: Michael Jordan Isn't The College Basketball GOAT. Breanna Stewart Is
item.description: ESPN's voters chose Jordan as the best college basketball player ever. LOL. Nope.

item.title: 'Sunderland 'Til I Die' Is TV's Best Show About Failure
item.description: The Netflix documentary series is the next best thing to watching sports themselves.

item.title: The Astonishing Rise Of 'Blair The Flair'
item.description: He's been a Beverly Hills rich kid, a teen on the run with his drug-kingpin dad and a homeless father scraping to get by. Next stop for Blair Cobbs: world champion boxer.

item.title: The Cheesy, Sexed-Up '8-Minute Abs' Video Still Holds Up, 25 Years Later
item.description: It made $20 million after its 1995 release for very good reason.

item.title: A Letter From The Coronavirus Quarantine: Missing Serie A, Pasta And Friendship
item.description: Wright Thompson reflects on sport, food and loneliness in the time of coronavirus.

item.title: One Man's Role In A 6,000-Mile Run Through North America
item.description: When Noé Álvarez joined an extraordinary ultramarathon he tested himself physically and mentally, while also connecting with his heritage.

item.title: The World's Biggest David Beckham Memorabilia Collector Is Thai Pop Star Tae
item.description: Imagine not one unseen Picasso, but an entire exhibition. Meet Sattawat Sethakorn and his potentially million-dollar collection of soccer boots.

item.title: What Happens When Two Strangers Trust The Rides Of Their Lives To The Magic Of The Universe
item.description: Leon had been riding west for 309 days. Noel had headed east for 176. Their meeting in the desert was a small miracle.

item.title: How Eliud Kipchoge Broke Marathon Running's Mythic 2-Hour Barrier
item.description: It was one of sport's great question marks: Is it humanly possible to run 26.2 miles in under two hours? Then Eliud Kipchoge did it. What followed was international fame — and plenty of controversy. So we flew to Kipchoge's ultra-rarefied Kenyan training ground to meet the man who pulled off the impossible.
item.kicker: ONE FOOT IN FRONT OF THE OTHER

item.title: The Dark Side Of The Dream
item.description: As African players find stardom in the NBA, unscrupulous coaches and brokers are descending on — and sometimes trafficking — teens with big aspirations.
